subject: Travel
title: The Maritime Silk Road
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Maritime Silk Road.

hook.text: Not all Silk Road trade went by land. A parallel route ran by sea from China to East Africa.

buildup.text: Massive Chinese junks carried porcelain, silk, and tea across the Indian Ocean.

discovery.text: Arab sailors mastered the monsoon winds, timing voyages to ride seasonal currents both ways.

twist.text: The sea route was faster and cheaper, but storms and pirates made it equally dangerous.

climax.text: A 9th-century shipwreck found near Indonesia carried 60,000 ceramic pieces from Tang China.

punchline.text: The ocean was the Silk Road's faster, wilder twin.

quiz.question: What advantage did the Maritime Silk Road have over land routes?
